job_title: Community Engagement Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: - amazing team members and leadership team - empathy based communication - flexible work schedule
cons: - hard to climb the ladder and get proportiate salary based on work

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in London, ON
pros: TakingITGlobal is a great organization to work in. It embraces diversity and is always taking care of its employees' needs. It has a lot of professional development resources that will help you succeed in your role.
cons: So far, I haven't identified a major concern that makes me change my mind about working in the organization.
Sincerely, I don´t have anything negative to say about TakingITGlobal. I just have good thoughts. Only Pros no Cons.

review_title: One of my most valuable experiences to date
pros: TakingITGlobal was one of my most valuable work experiences to date. It was great to work with an organization that walks the talk, that has respect and consideration for the people they work with and work for, and for involving more people from the communities they are serving as project leads. I like that TIG is a youth organization that works for youth and with youth to ensure that youth voices and perspectives are included in the projects. Being able to lead a complex project was challenging but a really good growth opportunity for me, both personally and professionally.  Leadership trusts employees to do their work well while challenging them to nurture their strengths and go out of their comfort zone.  This trust allows employees to do their best work. Working at TakingITGlobal really felt like being part of a family and I will always be grateful for that experience. Even though I no longer work at TakingITGlobal, I am still involved in the organization as I believe they do good work for youth in Canada and around the world.

review_title: Great for young people trying to break in to the sector.
pros: young talent, able to make your ideas come to life, creative work space, great people to work with, freedom with your projects.
cons: very low pay for hours expected, disorganized senior management, top-down heavy, quick to drop programs to start new ones, quantity over quality.

pros:
-Have a real, tangible, positive impact with an established global nonprofit!
-Many opportunities to take on new challenges and grow professionally
-Staff and volunteers are smart, interesting, and friendly
-Lots of encouragement and feedback from managers and peers
-Weekly staff meetings facilitates a good culture and communication
-Solid network of members, partnering organizations, and companies
-You can have freedom and creativity in your work
cons: It is somewhat unstructured, which is common to smaller organizations. For most people, this kind of environment works better if you take initiative, and ownership, and collaborate with others.

job_title: Youth Engagement Coordinator in Montreal, QC
pros: NGO working for social good and youth empowerment. Great organization culture and human solution-oriented approach. Inspiring and passionate people and dynamic co-founders. Work-life balance. Thinking globally, acting locally through various programs.
cons: Compensation is not attractive due to the nature of the organization and its funding structure (grants from foundations, donations, partnerships, etc). I cannot really think of other cons.

review_title: A strong mission for global education where everyone's ideas are welcomed
pros:
- Friendly, engaged team worked towards meaningful goals
- Lots of leadership opportunities
- Everyone's ideas and contributions are welcomed
- Fun social activities
- Commitment to a healthy office (wellness) and protecting the environment
- Open communication with staff
- Generous vacation policy and good work/life balance
cons:
- As a charity funding is always a challenge, so salaries are lower than in the private sector
- As a small organization opportunities for advancement are more limited

pros:
-plentiful opportunities to engage in meaningful projects
- good mentorship program
- friendly and supportive environment that is professional yet unpretentious  
- great networking opportunity in the non-profit sphere
cons: - internship was unpaid but a transportation stipend was offered
